explanation: Correct. The macro metal_unused(x) expands to do { (x) = (x); } while (0), so when used as metal_unused(params); it becomes params = params; which is an assignment to the parameter variable. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 prohibits modifying a function parameter (the pointer itself may not be modified, only the object it points to). Even though the assignment is a self-assignment and leaves the value unchanged (as the execution log shows), it is still a write side-effect to the parameter variable and therefore constitutes a modification. Recommendation: change the macro to one that does not perform an assignment, e.g. #define metal_unused(x) ((void)(x)) to suppress unused-parameter warnings without modifying the parameter.
